column4: I can't install Googleearth or Skype even with the Medibuntu repository enabled. Hint?
Have you tried the static files for Skype?
I use them without any troubles...
I wonder why they don't seem to appear on the list.
so you went to the original sources and installed them in both cases?
Yes with skype i did... I dont use Google Earth...
with the static version you don't need skytools, python-skype or skysentials (the only skype entries on the repo), I gather.
You just use the static package...
the package you pointed to is a .tar.bz2 one. Will extracting do the trick?
Yes... You are a beginner with Ubuntu?
no, actually. But I don't want it installed in the Chromium download directory. I wonder why it's no .deb.
This is no installer... Its just packed ready for you to use...
hmmm...so it won't give me a menu entry and it won't install it its own cozy niche.
